Update on NBPs Progress with AdaytumWhen Tuesday November PM PM GMT Central Time US Canada Where Conf Room Oma We have several questions regarding the remaining work that needs to be done to complete NBPs OM models in Adaytum ETS progress on its OM models in Adaytum and getting actuals into Adaytum once the OM models are completed Tracy Please let me know what phone number to use to reach the Houston attendees and I will initiate the conference call

Out of Office AutoReply RAC ProceduresI will be out of the office thru November If you need an immediate reply please respond to one of the following John Jesse RAC issues Phil Boggs Financial Planning issues

RE MOPS Final Review Cc FYI Brad Larsen left a voice mail message yesterday He had heard about the MOPS sale but has not seen anything on it Original Message From Peters Jerry Sent Tuesday October PM To Hayslett Rod Perchal Cheryl Cc Centilli James Goodpasture John Subject RE MOPS Final Review No Cheryl is checking with Brad Larson to see if anyone from ETS has presented this to RAC Original Message From Hayslett Rod Sent Tuesday October AM To Peters Jerry Perchal Cheryl Cc Centilli James Goodpasture John Subject FW MOPS Final Review Do either of you know if we have been to RAC with this sale Original Message From Goodpasture John Sent Friday October PM To Horton Stanley McCarty Danny Hayslett Rod Fossum Drew Lowry Phil Miller Mary Kay Kendrick William Craig Rick Pribble Dan McGee Johnny Huber Lee Burleson Bob Dowd Stephen Cc Stark Cindy Robertson Audrey Subject MOPS Final Review EBC has been reserved on Monday at PM for a final review of the MOPS transaction with Mr Horton You are encouraged to attend either by phone or in person If you will need a conference bridge please contact Audrey Robertson so arrangements can be made The discussion outline for this review is attached Thank you JNG File WESSummary of Final PSA provisionsdoc

RE Revised ETS Risk Management Procedures and Controls Cc There has been no major concerns Jo Williams wanted to revise the marketing flow chart to show that either the marketing vp pricing desk or trader will initiate a decision to enter into a position I did specify in this draft that the head trader would review approve and sign off on the Daily Position and PL Reports after the close of each business day There are some main differences in the way Caminus calculates VaR and the way Enron Corp calculates VaR These differences include Enron Corp uses approximately buckets of time while Caminus is limited to buckets of time ETS loads in the price curves every night while Enron Corp usually loads the curves every two weeks Right now Enron Corps VaR models are being revised and it is difficult to see how far off we are With respects to correlations we are really close on all except for those related to San Juan and Socal Enron Corp use implied volatility while Caminus uses historical volatilities Vernon Mercaldo is working with me to find why there is a difference in correlations with San Juan and Socal Enron RAC received the interim trading application yesterday and is circulating the application for signatures I plan to send the Procedures and Control document to Enron RAC this morning so they have it when they get Rick Buy and Jeff Skillings signatures Please call if you have further questions Original Message From Hayslett Rod Sent Friday July AM To Perchal Cheryl Subject RE Revised ETS Risk Management Procedures and Controls Importance High Did anyone have any concerns Original Message From Perchal Cheryl Sent Thursday July PM To Ferrell Lee Strohmeyer Vincent Fancler Dan Peters Jerry Hayslett Rod Saunders James Subject FW Revised ETS Risk Management Procedures and Controls Importance High I would like to send the attached document to Enron RAC today so that it can be attached to the ETS interim trading application Please let me know ASAP if you have any commentsrevisions Original Message From Perchal Cheryl Sent Tuesday July PM To Mercaldo Vernon Ferrell Lee Strohmeyer Vincent Fancler Dan Peters Jerry Hayslett Rod Saunders James Cc Jesse III John Subject Revised ETS Risk Management Procedures and Controls Importance High Attached is a revised ETS Risk Management Procedures and Controls I would like to send this to Enron RAC on Thursday July so that we can start getting the Enron RAC approvals in process If you have any comments or questions regarding the attached please call I can be reached at File ETSproceduredoc

RE Board Presentation Short Fuse Cc Below are ETSs limits Proposed Net Open Position Limit measurement and methodology Aggregate of the open Positions within the Natural Gas Commodity Group BCF Equivalent Proposed MaturityGap Limit measurement and methodology The largest net open position in any consecutive month period BCF Equivalent Proposed VaR calculation source of specific inputs for calculation etc VaR calculation is Riskmetrics model as calculated within ZaiNet Manager based on a confidence level over a one day time continuum Inputs for calculations are open positions correlations volatilities and forward prices Forward curves for basis index NG IR FX and implied volatilities supplied from Corp Confidentiality Agreement executed for NNG TW Historic volatilities and correlations calculated and uploaded nightly million Loss Notifications Losses within the Natural Gas Commodity Group Daily Loss Cumulative Day Loss Please call if you have any questions Original Message From Hayden Frank Sent Monday July AM To Hayslett Rod Cc Perchal Cheryl Stathis Kristin Subject Board Presentation Short Fuse Importance High Please let me know as soon as possible the limit request to be proposed to the Board in the upcoming meeting These are limit request for ETS and Portland General Specifically I need to understand limit as well as notification levels Sorry for the rush I have some of this already I just want to verify to minimize misunderstandings and better manage expectations Thanks Frank VAR Net Open Position Maturity Gap Loss Notification Other
